subject: RE: [junit] JUnit 3.5 & Ant 1.3
msgSnippet: I don t know anything about refid but is junit included in the classpath? See the example build file below. (Some of the junit stuff is derived from
messageBody:
I don't know anything about refid but is junit included in the classpath?
See the example build file below. (Some of the junit stuff is derived from
<http://www-106.ibm.com/developerworks/library/j-ant/?dwzone=java> )

Marc

============= build.xml begin
<?xml version="1.0"?>

<project name="xfiles" default="jar" basedir=".">

<target name="init">
<property name="name" value="xfiles" />
<property name="src.dir" value="src" />
<property name="lib.dir" value="lib" />
<property name="build.dir" value="build" />
<property name="dist.dir" value="dist" />
<property name="build.compiler" value="classic" />
<property name="junit.dir" value="../junit3.5/junit.jar" />
</target>

<target name="JUNIT">
<available classname="junit.framework.TestCase"
classpath="${junit.dir}/" property="junit.present" />
</target>

<target name="clean" depends="init">
<delete dir="${build.dir}" />
<delete dir="${dist.dir}" />
</target>

<target name="prepare" depends="init">
<mkdir dir="${build.dir}" />
<mkdir dir="${build.dir}/META-INF" />
<mkdir dir="${dist.dir}" />
</target>

<target name="compile" depends="prepare,JUNIT">
<javac srcdir="${src.dir}"
destdir="${build.dir}/"
classpath="${lib.dir}/:${junit.dir}/"
includes="**" />
</target>

<target name="runtests" depends="compile" if="junit.present">
<java fork="yes" classname="junit.textui.TestRunner"
taskname="junit" failonerror="true">
<arg value="se.offex.jnitnpapi.MarketTest"/>
<classpath>
<pathelement location="${build.dir}"/>
<pathelement path="${junit.dir}/" />
<pathelement path=""/>
<pathelement path="${java.class.path}"/>
</classpath>
</java>
</target>

<target name="launchjunit" depends="compile" if="junit.present">
<java fork="yes" classname="junit.swingui.TestRunner"
taskname="junit" failonerror="true">
<classpath>
<pathelement location="${build.dir}"/>
<pathelement path="${junit.dir}/" />
<pathelement path=""/>
<pathelement path="${java.class.path}"/>
</classpath>
</java>
</target>

<target name="lj" depends="launchjunit"/>

</project>
============= build.xml end

-----Original Message-----
From: Denny Chambers
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Sent: 2001-03-15 19:34
Subject: [junit] JUnit 3.5 & Ant 1.3

All,

I am having a problem running my JUnit tests through Ant. I can build
them fine using Ant. All of the classes are found properly. However when
I try to run the test the JUnit classes can not be found on the
classpath. I am using the same <classpath refid="test.build.classpath"
/> to run the tests that I am using to build. This makes me think that
there is a bug with classpath refid in JUnit. I have seen postings on
the Ant mailing list where people have had similar problems, but I
haven't seen any real fixes. Can anyone help?

Thanks,
--
Denny Chambers
Linux Java Engineer
Connex, Inc
Voice: 770-455-7653
Fax: 770-455-7325
